By conducting vast arcane energies through her massive elk-like horns and dispersing it into the surrounding air, Coeurlregina is said to be capable of altering the weather itself.

fixed_cards.name: Poroggo
fixed_cards.description: Poroggos were once lowly toads, transformed into creatures of speech and reason through the magicks of Sharlayan mages. Their intelligence is such that they can even be taught to cast spells. Should poroggos be isolated from other sentient beings, however, their minds gradually regress into a feral state.

fixed_cards.name: Crawler
fixed_cards.description: This corpulent vilekin infests the Dravanian hinterlands, its distinctive black and yellow coloring warning potential predators of its toxic nature. Curious gourmands beware: consuming a crawler's flesh without the proper preparation invariably results in excruciating abdominal pain.

variable_cards.name: Roundrox
variable_cards.description: “Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.”

variable_cards.name: Sahagin
variable_cards.description: These aquatic beastmen reside in a city at the bottom of the Indigo Deep. They breathe water as well as air, and glide through the depths with graceful ease. The social structure of the Sahagin resembles a pyramid, with a single queen-like figure stationed at its point. On the streets of Limsa Lominsa, to mention the name of Sahagin is to invite dark looks and muttered curses.

variable_cards.name: Ixal
variable_cards.description: This aggressive mountain tribe claim the wind-blasted canyons of Xelphatol as their domain. Though their race has long since lost the capacity for flight, the feathered beastmen are fervently proud of their vestigial wings. The Ixal seek to reestablish their presence in the Black Shroud that they might once again fell trees in worship of their fickle deity─an ambition which places them at odds with the people of Gridania.

variable_cards.name: Amalj'aa
variable_cards.description: The Amalj'aa are a race of nomadic beastmen who inhabit the grasslands of Paglth'an, where they subsist by hunting the native wildlife. They share a long and bitter history of conflict with the people of Ul'dah. Trained in the arts of war from a tender age, all members of an Amalj'aa clan, old and young, male and female, are skilled warriors. They also boast a fine mastery of metallurgy, and their weapons fetch a tidy sum from those seeking arms of quality.

variable_cards.name: Kobold
variable_cards.description: The kobolds are a race of mole-like creatures who have excavated a warren of tunnels under O'Ghomoro, a mountain situated in northern Vylbrand. Believing the ores of the earth to be a gift of the primal Titan, these subterranean beastmen seek to divine their deity's teachings through the arts of alchemy. The peace agreement forged between the kobolds and Limsa Lominsa has served little to quell resurgent hostilities.

rewards.name: Crawler
rewards.description: This corpulent vilekin infests the Dravanian hinterlands, its distinctive black and yellow coloring warning potential predators of its toxic nature. Curious gourmands beware: consuming a crawler's flesh without the proper preparation invariably results in excruciating abdominal pain.

rewards.name: Poroggo
rewards.description: Poroggos were once lowly toads, transformed into creatures of speech and reason through the magicks of Sharlayan mages. Their intelligence is such that they can even be taught to cast spells. Should poroggos be isolated from other sentient beings, however, their minds gradually regress into a feral state.

rewards.name: Roundrox
rewards.description: “Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.”

fixed_cards.name: Brute Justice
fixed_cards.description: Charged with the protection of Alexander, Brute Justice is a remarkable amalgamation of five separate guardians. With Onslaughter as its core, Vortexer, Swindler, Blaster, and Brawler complete the union. Brute Justice's lack of autonomy is balanced by its incorruptible loyalty to Quickthinx Allthoughts.

fixed_cards.name: Roundrox
fixed_cards.description: “Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.”

variable_cards.name: Poroggo
variable_cards.description: Poroggos were once lowly toads, transformed into creatures of speech and reason through the magicks of Sharlayan mages. Their intelligence is such that they can even be taught to cast spells. Should poroggos be isolated from other sentient beings, however, their minds gradually regress into a feral state.

variable_cards.name: Crawler
variable_cards.description: This corpulent vilekin infests the Dravanian hinterlands, its distinctive black and yellow coloring warning potential predators of its toxic nature. Curious gourmands beware: consuming a crawler's flesh without the proper preparation invariably results in excruciating abdominal pain.

variable_cards.name: Y'shtola
variable_cards.description: “The seas continue to rise while the lesser moon continues to fall, and ilm by ilm, the world becomes ever more unlike itself.”

variable_cards.name: Alphinaud & Alisaie
variable_cards.description: “Our paths may differ, but our destination is the same. In time, I daresay we will see eye to eye.”

rewards.name: Brute Justice
rewards.description: Charged with the protection of Alexander, Brute Justice is a remarkable amalgamation of five separate guardians. With Onslaughter as its core, Vortexer, Swindler, Blaster, and Brawler complete the union. Brute Justice's lack of autonomy is balanced by its incorruptible loyalty to Quickthinx Allthoughts.

rewards.name: Roundrox
rewards.description: “Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.”

rewards.name: Alexander Prime
rewards.description: Alexander Prime served as the last line of defense for the mechanical primal's innermost core. As an integral element of the core's central control system, Alexander Prime exhibited a limited ability to manipulate temporal reality, and sought to smite intruders with its divine judgment.

fixed_cards.name: Echidna
fixed_cards.description: Echidna is the name of an alluring voidsent bound within the enigmatic Void Ark. The voidmages of Mhach, a city that thrived during the Fifth Astral Era, were said to have employed the fiendish entity as a strategic weapon in their endless conflicts. Scholars conjecture that as a member of voidsent nobility, Echidna likely occupies one of the higher rungs of the hierarchy.

fixed_cards.name: Calofisteri
fixed_cards.description: Head crowned with animate tresses and mind caressed by madness, Calofisteri haunts the Tomb of the Nullstone as the relic's self-appointed guardian. This mighty sorceress of Mhach achieved a twisted form of immortality by combining the power of aether-infused crystal with the ritual consumption of voidsent blood.

fixed_cards.name: Diabolos Hollow
fixed_cards.description: By absorbing the power of Scathach, Diabolos's own might was enhanced by an order of magnitude. Encased in armor of hardened shadow, and commanding ruinous new magicks, the master of nightmare boasted a strength to rival the greatest entities of the voidsent hierarchy.

variable_cards.name: Ferdiad
variable_cards.description: Summoned in ages past by the sorcerers of Mhach to join the assault on Amdapor, this scythe-wielding voidsent was defeated by the city's defenders and consigned to languish behind potent seals. As a lesser noble, Ferdiad occupies the third rung of the hierarchy of twelve.

variable_cards.name: Moglin
variable_cards.description: “And what better way to help you pass the time than by having you perform all the tiresome tasks that no one ever wants to do, kupo!”

variable_cards.name: Vanu Vanu
variable_cards.description: An avian beast tribe that makes their home on the floating islands of the Sea of Clouds. Isolated from the world in the years prior to the advent of airship technology, in recent years they have grown wary of those who would encroach upon their homeland.

variable_cards.name: Paissa
variable_cards.description: Discovered on the floating islands of the Sea of Clouds, paissas are mischievous, fur-covered beastkin with barrel-like bodies and saucer-sized eyes. There is a theory gaining popularity among naturalists that the paissa is closely related to the opo-opo; the Vanu, however, are content to simply classify these creatures as incarnations of pure idiocy.

variable_cards.name: Gaelicat
variable_cards.description: A curious, charming creature with a feline body and the wings of a bat. Some scholars posit that it is a type of beastkin, while others insist that it is a lesser voidsent belonging to the eleventh rung of the hierarchy of twelve. One thing that cannot be denied is that it clearly possesses a keen, mischievous intelligence.

rewards.name: Echidna
rewards.description: Echidna is the name of an alluring voidsent bound within the enigmatic Void Ark. The voidmages of Mhach, a city that thrived during the Fifth Astral Era, were said to have employed the fiendish entity as a strategic weapon in their endless conflicts. Scholars conjecture that as a member of voidsent nobility, Echidna likely occupies one of the higher rungs of the hierarchy.

rewards.name: Calofisteri
rewards.description: Head crowned with animate tresses and mind caressed by madness, Calofisteri haunts the Tomb of the Nullstone as the relic's self-appointed guardian. This mighty sorceress of Mhach achieved a twisted form of immortality by combining the power of aether-infused crystal with the ritual consumption of voidsent blood.

rewards.name: Diabolos Hollow
rewards.description: By absorbing the power of Scathach, Diabolos's own might was enhanced by an order of magnitude. Encased in armor of hardened shadow, and commanding ruinous new magicks, the master of nightmare boasted a strength to rival the greatest entities of the voidsent hierarchy.

rewards.name: Ferdiad
rewards.description: Summoned in ages past by the sorcerers of Mhach to join the assault on Amdapor, this scythe-wielding voidsent was defeated by the city's defenders and consigned to languish behind potent seals. As a lesser noble, Ferdiad occupies the third rung of the hierarchy of twelve.

fixed_cards.name: Cloud of Darkness
fixed_cards.description: One of the undisputed rulers of the void and an entity of immeasurable strength, the Cloud of Darkness occupies the highest rung of the hierarchy of twelve. This terrifying voidsent entered into a dark covenant with Emperor Xande of Allag in a bid to invade the physical realm.

fixed_cards.name: Xande
fixed_cards.description: Xande, the first emperor of Allag, was resurrected from the sleep of death by the technologist Amon. Exhuming the ruler's body from his tomb, Amon cultivated the inert vessel for immortality, enlarging and strengthening Xande's form. After the emperor's successful rebirth, clones were made to serve as doubles.

fixed_cards.name: Phlegethon
fixed_cards.description: Phlegethon was a hero of the rebellion that sought to oppose the rule of Allag in the twilight of the Third Astral Era. After his capture by the technologist Amon, the valiant general was subjected to hideous experiments, his body altered and mind broken, fated to become an eternal guardian of the Crystal Tower.

variable_cards.name: Cid Garlond
variable_cards.description: “Just how long have I worn these damn goggles?”

variable_cards.name: Biggs & Wedge
variable_cards.description:
“Biggs─I'm going in! See everyone to safety!”
“No! Wedge─don't do it!”

variable_cards.name: Nero tol Scaeva
variable_cards.description: “Garlond... Soon you will be made to know the true power of magitek.”

rewards.name: Phlegethon
rewards.description: Phlegethon was a hero of the rebellion that sought to oppose the rule of Allag in the twilight of the Third Astral Era. After his capture by the technologist Amon, the valiant general was subjected to hideous experiments, his body altered and mind broken, fated to become an eternal guardian of the Crystal Tower.

rewards.name: Xande
rewards.description: Xande, the first emperor of Allag, was resurrected from the sleep of death by the technologist Amon. Exhuming the ruler's body from his tomb, Amon cultivated the inert vessel for immortality, enlarging and strengthening Xande's form. After the emperor's successful rebirth, clones were made to serve as doubles.

rewards.name: Cloud of Darkness
rewards.description: One of the undisputed rulers of the void and an entity of immeasurable strength, the Cloud of Darkness occupies the highest rung of the hierarchy of twelve. This terrifying voidsent entered into a dark covenant with Emperor Xande of Allag in a bid to invade the physical realm.

rewards.name: Unei & Doga
rewards.description: “'Tis for no other purpose but to put an end to Xande's madness that we exist. This is the mantle we have inherited from our namesakes.”

fixed_cards.name: Honoroit
fixed_cards.description: “Oh dear, oh dear...and just when everything was going so well...”

fixed_cards.name: Artoirel de Fortemps
fixed_cards.description: “I am no stranger to the battlefield, Ser Aymeric! My arm will not falter; my shield will not break! Halone as my witness, we will bring these fanatics to justice!”

fixed_cards.name: Emmanellain de Fortemps
fixed_cards.description: “'Tis a pleasure to see you again, my lady Laniaitte! You cut an elegant figure as always─a steel-clad rose, equally at home on a battlefield or in a ballroom.”

fixed_cards.name: Haurchefant
fixed_cards.description: “The docility to accept well-nigh impossible commands, the physical talents to carry them out─to a warrior born such as I there are no virtues greater in a steed! I say, be my personal steed!”

fixed_cards.name: Count Edmont de Fortemps
fixed_cards.description: “As wards of House Fortemps, you shall be afforded every courtesy. My home is your home.”

rewards.name: Honoroit
rewards.description: “Oh dear, oh dear...and just when everything was going so well...”

rewards.name: Artoirel de Fortemps
rewards.description: “I am no stranger to the battlefield, Ser Aymeric! My arm will not falter; my shield will not break! Halone as my witness, we will bring these fanatics to justice!”

rewards.name: Emmanellain de Fortemps
rewards.description: “'Tis a pleasure to see you again, my lady Laniaitte! You cut an elegant figure as always─a steel-clad rose, equally at home on a battlefield or in a ballroom.”

fixed_cards.name: Frixio
fixed_cards.description: “Mayhap not so fresh...but better than before.”

fixed_cards.name: Ahriman
fixed_cards.description: Ahriman are a family of voidsent that manifest in the physical plane by investing their essences in the eyes of animals. They are possessed of great arcane ability, and fly by clawing their way along airborne currents of aether. According to studies of voidsent hierarchy, the ahriman family is of middling class, its various forms occupying the fourth and fifth rungs.

fixed_cards.name: Apkallu
fixed_cards.description: These large, flightless seabirds dwell on the coastlines of Vylbrand. Though apkallu move on land with an awkward waddle, they use their flipper-like wings to glide through the water at impressive speeds. Able to adjust their stomach acids at will, the green-feathered cloudkin store fish in their bellies for feeding their young, but have also been known to spit caustic fluids at predators.

variable_cards.name: Mother Miounne
variable_cards.description: “Great or small, every contribution counts. I trust you will play your part.”

variable_cards.name: Pudding
variable_cards.description: These gelatinous creatures spawn in the agglomerations of residual matter that sometimes form in the void. Though able to mimic rudimentary sounds of speech in order to draw forth their prey, they are not thought to be especially intelligent beings. As a relatively low-ranked voidsent, flans occupy the tenth rung of the hierarchy.

variable_cards.name: Morbol
variable_cards.description: The morbol is a terrible beast that moves upon its slime-covered vines and roots. Highly aggressive, it kills both animals and plants with a combination of its noxious breath and ceaselessly flailing tendrils. Upon occasion, the beast will also emit a sweet-smelling gas which induces a deep sleep. Rather than rending or chewing, the fang-shaped thorns which line the morbol's maw serve to hold prey immobile during digestion.

variable_cards.name: Chocobo
variable_cards.description: The domestication of chocobos in Eorzea appears to date back to prehistory, with ancient paintings recently discovered near Ishgard showing tribesfolk using the flightless yellow cloudkin to till the earth, transport grain, and carry warriors into battle. While the overwhelming majority of chocobos seen in Eorzea today are of Coerthan stock, it is rumored that wild breeds of the species─including those which have retained the capacity for flight─still thrive throughout forests nestled in the vastly unexplored valleys of Abalathia's Spine.

rewards.name: Apkallu
rewards.description: These large, flightless seabirds dwell on the coastlines of Vylbrand. Though apkallu move on land with an awkward waddle, they use their flipper-like wings to glide through the water at impressive speeds. Able to adjust their stomach acids at will, the green-feathered cloudkin store fish in their bellies for feeding their young, but have also been known to spit caustic fluids at predators.

fixed_cards.name: Godbert Manderville
fixed_cards.description: “But you were not drawn here by some coincidence, were you? No, you came in search of me, Godbert! Why else would you gyrate your hips in such a gentlemanly fashion, if not that?”

fixed_cards.name: Lost Lamb
fixed_cards.description: Highlanders first domesticated sheep in the Age of Endless Frost. Seeking to increase wool yield, they began a program of selective breeding that resulted in the cloud-like appearance of the modern species. Over the years, a goodly number of sheep have been separated from their shepherds, and it is not uncommon to see wild flocks grazing the fields of La Noscea or the plains of Coerthas.

fixed_cards.name: Blue Dragon
fixed_cards.description: Sharing the blood of Midgardsormr and his progeny, the great wyrms, a blue dragon can live upwards of a thousand summers─a period during which the creature will undergo divers changes to its physical and mental capacities. This independent “evolution” of sorts renders each member of the species unique, making it all the more difficult for enemies of the dragons to conceive and establish any manner of standardized battle strategy.

variable_cards.name: Momodi Modi
variable_cards.description: “'Course, I *do* enjoy hearin' a lady muse on the many manhoods of her acquaintance from time to time...”

variable_cards.name: Vanu Vanu
variable_cards.description: An avian beast tribe that makes their home on the floating islands of the Sea of Clouds. Isolated from the world in the years prior to the advent of airship technology, in recent years they have grown wary of those who would encroach upon their homeland.

variable_cards.name: Coblyn
variable_cards.description: The coblyn is a creature of startling appearance that skitters around on its tentacle-like appendages in search of ore. Gridanian scholars claim that a coblyn is an animal that fuses minerals to its body to create a defensive shell. Ul'dahn scholars dispute this theory, stating that these soulkin are, in fact, sentient clumps of geological matter that have adopted biological organs in order to facilitate propagation.

variable_cards.name: Chocobo
variable_cards.description: The domestication of chocobos in Eorzea appears to date back to prehistory, with ancient paintings recently discovered near Ishgard showing tribesfolk using the flightless yellow cloudkin to till the earth, transport grain, and carry warriors into battle. While the overwhelming majority of chocobos seen in Eorzea today are of Coerthan stock, it is rumored that wild breeds of the species─including those which have retained the capacity for flight─still thrive throughout forests nestled in the vastly unexplored valleys of Abalathia's Spine.

rewards.name: Lost Lamb
rewards.description: Highlanders first domesticated sheep in the Age of Endless Frost. Seeking to increase wool yield, they began a program of selective breeding that resulted in the cloud-like appearance of the modern species. Over the years, a goodly number of sheep have been separated from their shepherds, and it is not uncommon to see wild flocks grazing the fields of La Noscea or the plains of Coerthas.

fixed_cards.name: Leviathan
fixed_cards.description: Summoned by the Sahagin tribes of the Indigo Deep, the Lord of the Whorl ever lurks beneath the sea's surface, seeking ships to swallow and sailors to join his ranks of drowned minions. Fishers and saltwives throughout history have believed the tidal waves which oft flood their coastal villages are created by the thrashing tail of an angered Leviathan, and have for centuries offered sacrifices to the sea in hopes of soothing the serpent.

fixed_cards.name: Brendt, Brennan, & Bremondt
fixed_cards.description: “Become the sort of storied personage I can brag about havin' met, an' I'll consider us square.”

fixed_cards.name: Progenitrix
fixed_cards.description: The Progenitrix is a prototype bomb developed by ambitious kobold alchemists. Creating a bomb of this size requires a heat-shielded cobalt furnace, as well as a willingness to accept the possibility of lethal explosions during the compression process. For the kobolds, however, the exponential gain in potency appears to be worth risking a horrible, fiery death.

variable_cards.name: Urianger
variable_cards.description: “Truth interpreted is truth transformed. Today's heroes may yet become tomorrow's gods...or something else.”

variable_cards.name: Carvallain de Gorgagne
variable_cards.description: “Limsa Lominsa is a place where a man's work and wits determine his worth, where an orphan can pull himself up by his bootstraps to one day lead the Kraken's Arms!”

variable_cards.name: Paissa
variable_cards.description: Discovered on the floating islands of the Sea of Clouds, paissas are mischievous, fur-covered beastkin with barrel-like bodies and saucer-sized eyes. There is a theory gaining popularity among naturalists that the paissa is closely related to the opo-opo; the Vanu, however, are content to simply classify these creatures as incarnations of pure idiocy.

variable_cards.name: Baderon Tenfingers
variable_cards.description: “Me da once said, if me ma 'erself was ever t' stand 'twixt 'im and a life o' 'venturin', 'e'd straightways up an' drown th' wench.”

rewards.name: Brendt, Brennan, & Bremondt
rewards.description: “Become the sort of storied personage I can brag about havin' met, an' I'll consider us square.”

fixed_cards.name: Nael van Darnus
fixed_cards.description: “The hour of cleansing is at hand—by my searing light shall the world be purged of its taint.”

fixed_cards.name: Vidofnir
fixed_cards.description: Vidofnir was sired by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr. A creature of great age, she has memories of the era when man and dragon lived together in peace, and is revered as an elder by others of her brood.

variable_cards.name: Byblos
variable_cards.description: A forbidding presence that guards the door to the forbidden halls of the Great Gubal Library. Presumed to be a voidsent summoned from the dark realm by Sharlayan magi, it dutifully guards its post as if bound there by some dark covenant.

variable_cards.name: Behemoth
variable_cards.description: The first sightings of these heavily muscled beasts in the mountains of Coerthas coincided with the advent of the Seventh Umbral Era. Scholars believe them to be the spawn of the elder primal Bahamut, and have dubbed the creatures “behemoths.”Aside from their obvious physical traits, much about behemoth behavior and physiology remains shrouded in mystery.

variable_cards.name: Griffin
variable_cards.description: The majestic winged creatures inhabit the untamed wilds of Abalathia's Spine. Possessed of unmatched sharpness of vision, a griffin swooping down from the heights to seize its prey in its mighty talons is truly a sight to behold. A symbol of courage and ferocity, the griffin adorns the crest of the fallen nation of Ala Mhigo.

variable_cards.name: Haurchefant
variable_cards.description: “The docility to accept well-nigh impossible commands, the physical talents to carry them out─to a warrior born such as I there are no virtues greater in a steed! I say, be my personal steed!”

variable_cards.name: Godbert Manderville
variable_cards.description: “But you were not drawn here by some coincidence, were you? No, you came in search of me, Godbert! Why else would you gyrate your hips in such a gentlemanly fashion, if not that?”

rewards.name: Nael van Darnus
rewards.description: “The hour of cleansing is at hand—by my searing light shall the world be purged of its taint.”

rewards.name: Colibri
rewards.description: The distinctive beak of the colorful colibri is said to have evolved from its preference to feed on the nectar of tropical blooms, though its obsession with shiny objects also leads the bird to occasionally swallow shellfish whole. With sufficient time and effort, it is possible to train this native of the south seas to mimic words from the common tongue.

quest.name: By the Grace of Lord Lolorito

fixed_cards.name: Tioman
fixed_cards.description: A mighty and vengeful dragon who makes her lair in the ghostly peak of Sohm Al. Consort of Nidhogg, one of the seven great wyrms, Tioman is known as the dark dragon among the Ishgardian people by virtue of her scales, which are said to be darker than a starless night.

fixed_cards.name: Kotokaze
fixed_cards.description: “We would welcome your custom, miss.”

fixed_cards.name: Tonberry
fixed_cards.description: Little is known about this inscrutable race of manlike creatures that inhabits the ruins of Nym─a culture that reached its peak during the Fifth Astral Era. Tonberries wear clothing and are adept in the use of complex tools, both of which would seem to suggest a civilized level of intelligence. Recently discovered texts from Nymian times suggest that the green denizens of the Wanderer's Palace are the carriers of a terrible pestilence.

variable_cards.name: Momodi Modi
variable_cards.description: “'Course, I *do* enjoy hearin' a lady muse on the many manhoods of her acquaintance from time to time...”

variable_cards.name: Baderon Tenfingers
variable_cards.description: “Me da once said, if me ma 'erself was ever t' stand 'twixt 'im and a life o' 'venturin', 'e'd straightways up an' drown th' wench.”

variable_cards.name: Mother Miounne
variable_cards.description: “Great or small, every contribution counts. I trust you will play your part.”

rewards.name: Kotokaze
rewards.description: “We would welcome your custom, miss.”

fixed_cards.name: Rasho
fixed_cards.description: “Men who revere manners and tradition can be found the world over. But not here.”

fixed_cards.name: Hilda
fixed_cards.description: “...And what makes you think I have friends in high places?”

fixed_cards.name: Chimera
fixed_cards.description: A nightmarish combination of lion, goat, and dragon, the fell chimera has three heads, a pair of mighty wings, and a cruelly barbed tail. Its origins have been furiously debated, with some insisting the creature a cruel jest of the gods, while others believe it the twisted creation of forbidden sorcery.

variable_cards.name: Mistbeard
variable_cards.description: “Steel yourself for the wrath of Mistbeard! King of the five seas!”

variable_cards.name: Demon Wall
variable_cards.description: These frightful guardians are the creations of ancient spellcraft, given life when a chosen wall was inscribed with an arcane pattern of blood. Though their masters have long since perished, these sentinels of demonic visage continue to protect the crumbling ruins to which they are bound─to the surprise and horror of many an unsuspecting adventurer.

variable_cards.name: Honoroit
variable_cards.description: “Oh dear, oh dear...and just when everything was going so well...”

variable_cards.name: Byblos
variable_cards.description: A forbidding presence that guards the door to the forbidden halls of the Great Gubal Library. Presumed to be a voidsent summoned from the dark realm by Sharlayan magi, it dutifully guards its post as if bound there by some dark covenant.

rewards.name: Rasho
rewards.description: “Men who revere manners and tradition can be found the world over. But not here.”

fixed_cards.name: Lucia goe Junius
fixed_cards.description: “Those who dwell in the past risk losing sight of their future.”

fixed_cards.name: Kojin
fixed_cards.description: This marine race of beastmen has lived in the Ruby Sea for generations. As at home underwater as they are on land, they have flourished on the bounty of the ocean. The Kojin revere the kami─a legion of gods found within the great and the small─and strive ceaselessly to collect those objects in which they believe their deities reside.

fixed_cards.name: Behemoth
fixed_cards.description: The first sightings of these heavily muscled beasts in the mountains of Coerthas coincided with the advent of the Seventh Umbral Era. Scholars believe them to be the spawn of the elder primal Bahamut, and have dubbed the creatures “behemoths.”Aside from their obvious physical traits, much about behemoth behavior and physiology remains shrouded in mystery.

variable_cards.name: Leviathan
variable_cards.description: Summoned by the Sahagin tribes of the Indigo Deep, the Lord of the Whorl ever lurks beneath the sea's surface, seeking ships to swallow and sailors to join his ranks of drowned minions. Fishers and saltwives throughout history have believed the tidal waves which oft flood their coastal villages are created by the thrashing tail of an angered Leviathan, and have for centuries offered sacrifices to the sea in hopes of soothing the serpent.

variable_cards.name: Siren
variable_cards.description: Once feared across the five seas, today sirens are but the stuff of legend, due in part to a thorough culling of the creatures some years past by the renowned pirate Mistbeard. Recent sightings of the seductive she-devils, however, once again have sea- and landsmen alike exchanging tales of sirens entrancing entire ship crews with their accursed songs, then feeding on their captives' souls until all that remain are lifeless husks.

variable_cards.name: Sahagin
variable_cards.description: These aquatic beastmen reside in a city at the bottom of the Indigo Deep. They breathe water as well as air, and glide through the depths with graceful ease. The social structure of the Sahagin resembles a pyramid, with a single queen-like figure stationed at its point. On the streets of Limsa Lominsa, to mention the name of Sahagin is to invite dark looks and muttered curses.

With sufficient time and effort, it is possible to train this native of the south seas to mimic words from the common tongue.

rewards.name: Kojin
rewards.description: This marine race of beastmen has lived in the Ruby Sea for generations. As at home underwater as they are on land, they have flourished on the bounty of the ocean. The Kojin revere the kami─a legion of gods found within the great and the small─and strive ceaselessly to collect those objects in which they believe their deities reside.

fixed_cards.name: Matoya
fixed_cards.description: “Spare me the hollow pleasantries, boy. I'll wager my remaining good teeth you didn't come to a forgotten corner of Eorzea to flirt with a wrinkly old woman.”

fixed_cards.name: Lolorito Nanarito
fixed_cards.description: “Precious or not, they were never yet so reliable. And unlike those who frequent your establishment, I have no desire to gamble with my future.”

fixed_cards.name: Namazu
fixed_cards.description: A beast tribe native to the Far East. Short and squat, the Namazu are nevertheless excellent swimmers, and subsist mainly on a diet of harpooned fish. Though proximity to the settlements of other races has done much to civilize these sociable creatures, a significant number of their clans yet remain wild and savage.

variable_cards.name: Opo-opo
variable_cards.description: These monkey-like beastkin are found inhabiting densely forested regions, with each colony consisting of several dozen individuals led by a single alpha. Possessed of long tails and opposable thumbs, opo-opos are often seen leaping nimbly from tree branch to tree branch in search of fruit─their favored food. In recent years, however, several colonies have discovered a taste for beans, leaving many a farmer cursing over their plundered fields.

variable_cards.name: Kobold
variable_cards.description: The kobolds are a race of mole-like creatures who have excavated a warren of tunnels under O'Ghomoro, a mountain situated in northern Vylbrand. Believing the ores of the earth to be a gift of the primal Titan, these subterranean beastmen seek to divine their deity's teachings through the arts of alchemy. The peace agreement forged between the kobolds and Limsa Lominsa has served little to quell resurgent hostilities.

variable_cards.name: Pudding
variable_cards.description: These gelatinous creatures spawn in the agglomerations of residual matter that sometimes form in the void. Though able to mimic rudimentary sounds of speech in order to draw forth their prey, they are not thought to be especially intelligent beings. As a relatively low-ranked voidsent, flans occupy the tenth rung of the hierarchy.

variable_cards.name: Great Gold Whisker
variable_cards.description: After learning that gold whisker dolls were popular in the Near East as talismans of good luck, this enterprising Namazu departed for Radz–at–Han to indulge in a life of idle idolatry. He dyed his skin a gleaming metal hue, proclaimed himself the “Great Gold Whisker,” and succeeded in installing himself as the blessed kami guardian of a treasure vault.

rewards.name: Namazu
rewards.description: A beast tribe native to the Far East. Short and squat, the Namazu are nevertheless excellent swimmers, and subsist mainly on a diet of harpooned fish. Though proximity to the settlements of other races has done much to civilize these sociable creatures, a significant number of their clans yet remain wild and savage.

rewards.name: Great Gold Whisker
rewards.description: After learning that gold whisker dolls were popular in the Near East as talismans of good luck, this enterprising Namazu departed for Radz–at–Han to indulge in a life of idle idolatry. He dyed his skin a gleaming metal hue, proclaimed himself the “Great Gold Whisker,” and succeeded in installing himself as the blessed kami guardian of a treasure vault.

fixed_cards.name: Minfilia
fixed_cards.description: “No doubt you're ripe to burst with questions, but have patience─all will be revealed in time.”

fixed_cards.name: Bismarck
fixed_cards.description: Long thought to be little more than myth, the Lord of the Mists was summoned forth and given form by the fervent prayers of the Vanu Vanu, who worship him as the god that led their ancestors to their island home. With a flood-blast of water from his great blowhole, the great white whale purges the skies of those who would do his followers harm.

fixed_cards.name: Cirina
fixed_cards.description: “The Mol hearken to the whispers of the elder gods, which guide us in our daily lives.”

variable_cards.name: Fenrir
variable_cards.description: A massive hoarhound beholden to Lady Iceheart. With its shimmering hide reminiscent of pale moonlight and a demeanor just as cold, this imposing beast was named after the legendary spirit-hound Fenrir.

variable_cards.name: Strix
variable_cards.description: A guardian bound to the Rare Tomes Room, the highest floor of the Great Gubal Library. Similar to skatenes, Strix is an owl which has been enchanted with heightened intelligence. Strix's comparatively vast intellect, however, grants the creature command over spells of formidable potency.

variable_cards.name: Godbert Manderville
variable_cards.description: “But you were not drawn here by some coincidence, were you? No, you came in search of me, Godbert! Why else would you gyrate your hips in such a gentlemanly fashion, if not that?”

rewards.name: Cirina
rewards.description: “The Mol hearken to the whispers of the elder gods, which guide us in our daily lives.”

rewards.name: Mammoth
rewards.description: These lumbering, herbivorous beastkin inhabit chilly plains and snowy mountainsides, protected from the elements by thick matted hides. Ordinarily placid in temperament, mammoths are known to become aggressive if startled, thrashing about with their long, curved tusks. Even the largest of predators will give these creatures a wide berth, preferring to avoid the risk of injury or death.

fixed_cards.name: Lahabrea
fixed_cards.description: “For the end of your tale is but the beginning of another... The tale of the Crystal's demise!”

fixed_cards.name: Diabolos Hollow
fixed_cards.description: By absorbing the power of Scathach, Diabolos's own might was enhanced by an order of magnitude. Encased in armor of hardened shadow, and commanding ruinous new magicks, the master of nightmare boasted a strength to rival the greatest entities of the voidsent hierarchy.

fixed_cards.name: Magnai
fixed_cards.description: “We shall not speak as equals. Born of the Sun are Oronir, and born of the earth are you.”

variable_cards.name: Roundrox
variable_cards.description: “Pssshkoh... Someday, Roundrox wants to live in place like giant, together with whirlycog things aplenty.”

variable_cards.name: Progenitrix
variable_cards.description: The Progenitrix is a prototype bomb developed by ambitious kobold alchemists. Creating a bomb of this size requires a heat-shielded cobalt furnace, as well as a willingness to accept the possibility of lethal explosions during the compression process. For the kobolds, however, the exponential gain in potency appears to be worth risking a horrible, fiery death.

variable_cards.name: Waukkeon
variable_cards.description: This giant sanuwa nests in Neverreap, an island sacred to the Vanu Vanu. The scales of the waukkeon glisten with liquid vibrancy, as if the life-giving rains that fall upon the floating isles were trapped within. If such a treasure could be pried from its hide, one might fashion a mask that granted the authority of a furious storm cloud.

rewards.name: Magnai
rewards.description: “We shall not speak as equals. Born of the Sun are Oronir, and born of the earth are you.”

rewards.name: Mammoth
rewards.description: These lumbering, herbivorous beastkin inhabit chilly plains and snowy mountainsides, protected from the elements by thick matted hides. Ordinarily placid in temperament, mammoths are known to become aggressive if startled, thrashing about with their long, curved tusks. Even the largest of predators will give these creatures a wide berth, preferring to avoid the risk of injury or death.

fixed_cards.name: Ramuh
fixed_cards.description: Worshipped by the sylphs of the Twelveswood, the Lord of Levin is a thunderous entity with boundless knowledge of ages past. He is stern yet just, but his judgment is final, and those found guilty of mortal sin will be met with mighty bolts of white-hot lightning.

fixed_cards.name: Cid Garlond
fixed_cards.description: “Just how long have I worn these damn goggles?”

fixed_cards.name: Sadu
fixed_cards.description: “None are braver than the Dotharl, for we do not fear death.”

variable_cards.name: Garuda
variable_cards.description: Summoned by the Ixal tribes of Xelphatol, Garuda harbors the uncanny ability to manipulate the very air which surrounds her. The winds she wields, however, have twisted her heart and broken her mind, rendering the Lady of the Vortex a merciless tyrant with an appetite for destruction that is nigh insatiable.

variable_cards.name: Lucia goe Junius
variable_cards.description: “Those who dwell in the past risk losing sight of their future.”

variable_cards.name: Count Edmont de Fortemps
variable_cards.description: “As wards of House Fortemps, you shall be afforded every courtesy. My home is your home.”

rewards.name: Sadu
rewards.description: “None are braver than the Dotharl, for we do not fear death.”

rewards.name: Mammoth
rewards.description: These lumbering, herbivorous beastkin inhabit chilly plains and snowy mountainsides, protected from the elements by thick matted hides. Ordinarily placid in temperament, mammoths are known to become aggressive if startled, thrashing about with their long, curved tusks. Even the largest of predators will give these creatures a wide berth, preferring to avoid the risk of injury or death.

fixed_cards.name: Hien
fixed_cards.description: “My blade or my head. Which would you have of me?”

fixed_cards.name: Hraesvelgr
fixed_cards.description: One of the seven great wyrms sired by Midgardsormr, Hraesvelgr shared a love with Saint Shiva that transcended race and reason. Their pure bond quelled the hostility between dragon and man, until one fateful day when mortal treachery shattered the peace and soured the wyrm's heart with grief.

fixed_cards.name: Alphinaud & Alisaie
fixed_cards.description: “Our paths may differ, but our destination is the same. In time, I daresay we will see eye to eye.”

variable_cards.name: Minfilia
variable_cards.description: “No doubt you're ripe to burst with questions, but have patience─all will be revealed in time.”

variable_cards.name: Matoya
variable_cards.description: “Spare me the hollow pleasantries, boy. I'll wager my remaining good teeth you didn't come to a forgotten corner of Eorzea to flirt with a wrinkly old woman.”

variable_cards.name: Yugiri Mistwalker
variable_cards.description: “To whom much is given, much is expected...”

rewards.name: Hien
rewards.description: “My blade or my head. Which would you have of me?”

fixed_cards.name: F'lhaminn
fixed_cards.description: “Have I become an open book, or has she acquired still greater powers of insight? I shall choose to believe the latter.”

fixed_cards.name: Ananta
fixed_cards.description: The Ananta are a people native to the Fringes of Gyr Abania. A race consisting entirely of females, they resemble women from the waist up, but take the form of undulating serpents from the waist down. They are known for their elegant metallic jewelry, which they shape with the caress of magic rather than by the blow of a hammer.

fixed_cards.name: Papalymo & Yda
fixed_cards.description:
“The great beyond! I do believe we're dead, Papalymo!”
“Oh, Rhalgr take you and your great beyond!”

variable_cards.name: Vedrfolnir
variable_cards.description: Sired by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr, Vedrfolnir's fiercely aggressive demeanor sets him apart from his tranquil broodmates. This mighty dragon revels in the glory of combat, and has fostered a deadly rivalry with Darkscale, a general in Nidhogg's Horde.

variable_cards.name: Carvallain de Gorgagne
variable_cards.description: “Limsa Lominsa is a place where a man's work and wits determine his worth, where an orphan can pull himself up by his bootstraps to one day lead the Kraken's Arms!”

variable_cards.name: Tataru Taru
variable_cards.description:
“Deep in the desert of my heart,♪
 A lonely flower blooms...♪
 Yearning for the heavens above♪
 To quench my thirst for you.♪
 Trololololo～lololo～♪”

variable_cards.name: Qiqirn Meateater
variable_cards.description: The Qiqirn tribes of Gyr Abania are an unusually bloodthirsty breed who consume the flesh of animal and man alike. Classified as wild beasts by the Garlean Empire and thus unworthy of contact, these carnivorous savages have been largely ignored even as they continue to terrorize local settlements.

rewards.name: Ananta
rewards.description: The Ananta are a people native to the Fringes of Gyr Abania. A race consisting entirely of females, they resemble women from the waist up, but take the form of undulating serpents from the waist down. They are known for their elegant metallic jewelry, which they shape with the caress of magic rather than by the blow of a hammer.

rewards.name: Qiqirn Meateater
rewards.description: The Qiqirn tribes of Gyr Abania are an unusually bloodthirsty breed who consume the flesh of animal and man alike. Classified as wild beasts by the Garlean Empire and thus unworthy of contact, these carnivorous savages have been largely ignored even as they continue to terrorize local settlements.

fixed_cards.name: Kan-E-Senna
fixed_cards.description: “Eorzea's children are as trees in a grove—bending to the wind like the willow, or bearing it like the oak. Yet live how we might, the wind shall blow.”

fixed_cards.name: Nael van Darnus
fixed_cards.description: “The hour of cleansing is at hand—by my searing light shall the world be purged of its taint.”

fixed_cards.name: Yotsuyu
fixed_cards.description: “My appetite for your agony is as an abyss─bottomless. Insatiable.”

variable_cards.name: Armored Weapon
variable_cards.description: Heavily armored and heavily armed, this magitek weapon maintains stability by shifting weight over its multiple mechanical legs. The pilot sits ensconced within a sealed cockpit, protected from the weapon's explosive firepower─a notable improvement over previous designs.

variable_cards.name: Estinien
variable_cards.description: “...But I yearn to spill the blood of a great wyrm, Nidhogg, and only your death will sate my lance.”

variable_cards.name: Papalymo & Yda
variable_cards.description:
“The great beyond! I do believe we're dead, Papalymo!”
“Oh, Rhalgr take you and your great beyond!”

variable_cards.name: Fordola rem Lupis
variable_cards.description: “You're no kin of mine!”

rewards.name: Yotsuyu
rewards.description: “My appetite for your agony is as an abyss─bottomless. Insatiable.”

rewards.name: Fordola rem Lupis
rewards.description: “You're no kin of mine!”

rewards.name: Grynewaht
rewards.description: “It's like all my namedays have come at once!”

fixed_cards.name: Arenvald Lentinus
fixed_cards.description: “For a long time, I struggled to make sense of that day at the Waking Sands. Why I survived when A'aba and Aulie didn't. Not anymore.”

fixed_cards.name: Aymeric
fixed_cards.description: “Upon the souls of they who have sacrificed themselves to pave the way for peace, we will never abandon our cause.”

fixed_cards.name: Sephirot
fixed_cards.description: Sephirot was revered as the world's first sacred tree, elevated to godhood by the belief of its devoted worshipers. This towering pillar of the Warring Triad is capable of inducing spontaneous growth, allowing the eikon to enlarge its own form to enormous proportions.

variable_cards.name: Coeurlregina
variable_cards.description: A legend amongst the hunters of Tailfeather, this aged matriarch of the coeurls has attained immense size and magical potency. By conducting vast arcane energies through her massive elk-like horns and dispersing it into the surrounding air, Coeurlregina is said to be capable of altering the weather itself.

variable_cards.name: Tozol Huatotl
variable_cards.description: Tozol is of the Huatotl bloodline─one of the four great Ixali families said to be descended from the “Skysent.” Numbered among the few ritualists capable of performing the rites of primal summoning, Tozol attempted to call forth the capricious Garuda in the stronghold of Xelphatol.

variable_cards.name: Lava Scorpion
variable_cards.description: A creature of living lava, this hulking nightmare lurked in the pools of magma hidden within the heart of Sohm Al. When the dragons were no longer present to keep the scorpion in check, the ancient menace resurfaced and began agitating the mountain's volcanic core with its wild thrashing.

rewards.name: Arenvald Lentinus
rewards.description: “For a long time, I struggled to make sense of that day at the Waking Sands. Why I survived when A'aba and Aulie didn't. Not anymore.”

rewards.name: Phoebad
rewards.description: Phoebads are a type of golem that occur naturally in areas rich in salt crystals, such as Loch Seld and other similar bodies of water. In folklore, phoebads are said to have once been people who defied the revelations of Rhalgr, and were transformed as punishment for their disobedience.

fixed_cards.name: Asahi sas Brutus
fixed_cards.description: “Will you surrender to anger, then? Slay an anointed emissary to avenge a fallen foe?”

fixed_cards.name: Grynewaht
fixed_cards.description: “It's like all my namedays have come at once!”

fixed_cards.name: Armored Weapon
fixed_cards.description: Heavily armored and heavily armed, this magitek weapon maintains stability by shifting weight over its multiple mechanical legs. The pilot sits ensconced within a sealed cockpit, protected from the weapon's explosive firepower─a notable improvement over previous designs.

fixed_cards.name: Magitek Sky Armor
fixed_cards.description: An airborne unit constructed to accommodate a single pilot, sky armor is designed for maximum maneuverability. Previous flying models such as the juggernaut have, by necessity, been built on an enormous scale, but by implementing the advances made in the invention of the reaper, imperial engineers have succeeded in creating significantly smaller vessels.

variable_cards.name: Magitek Predator
variable_cards.description: The most recent model in the Empire's line of piloted magitek armor. Though based on the reaper design, the predator has been outfitted with bladed arms to improve its close-quarter combat capabilities and also features simplified armor plating for enhanced mobility.

variable_cards.name: Yotsuyu
variable_cards.description: “My appetite for your agony is as an abyss─bottomless. Insatiable.”

variable_cards.name: Zenos yae Galvus
variable_cards.description: “Do not disappoint me, girl. Or I will kill you.”

variable_cards.name: Magitek Death Claw
variable_cards.description: A redesign of the Allagan “iron claw,” the magitek death claw is kept aloft by the twin rotors housed within its main trunk. While the claw's curved talons are often employed to transport military cargo, it is also deployed on the battlefield to immobilize enemy soldiers.

variable_cards.name: Magitek Vanguard
variable_cards.description: The main duty of the autonomous vanguard is to put its cermet drills to work boring through castle gates and defensive bulwarks. True to its name, the vanguard is also employed as an advance troop unit, as well as fulfilling the role of base sentinel by destroying enemy siege weaponry. Heavy infantry variations with enhanced armor and shock troop units with increased mobility are also known to exist.

rewards.name: Asahi sas Brutus
rewards.description: “Will you surrender to anger, then? Slay an anointed emissary to avenge a fallen foe?”

rewards.name: Zenos yae Galvus
rewards.description: “Do not disappoint me, girl. Or I will kill you.”

fixed_cards.name: Lupin
fixed_cards.description: This wolf-headed beast tribe has its origins on the continent of Othard. Known for their martial traditions, the Lupin became an integral part of Doman warfare after several of their clans pledged fealty to the region's warlords during their endless clash for supremacy. When the Empire seized control, however, many Lupin were conscripted into the imperial army and forced to fight abroad.

fixed_cards.name: Brute Justice
fixed_cards.description: Charged with the protection of Alexander, Brute Justice is a remarkable amalgamation of five separate guardians. With Onslaughter as its core, Vortexer, Swindler, Blaster, and Brawler complete the union. Brute Justice's lack of autonomy is balanced by its incorruptible loyalty to Quickthinx Allthoughts.

fixed_cards.name: Ravana
fixed_cards.description: Wrath of the Colony and the god and savior of the Gnath tribe. A proud warrior and conqueror, Lord Ravana exalts strength and abhors weakness in any form. Believing the rite of combat to be sacred, he revels in battle with worthy opponents while wielding the Chandrahas─legendary blades of moonlight that obey his every command.

variable_cards.name: Koja
variable_cards.description: A golem mainly constructed for the purpose of serving onmyoji and geomancers, the bulbous form of a koja is fashioned from sticky mud and imbued with the spirit of a shikigami. The features common to all koja are believed to be modeled after the original creator─a eunuch from ancient times─but no portrait has ever been found to substantiate this claim.

variable_cards.name: Moglin
variable_cards.description: “And what better way to help you pass the time than by having you perform all the tiresome tasks that no one ever wants to do, kupo!”

variable_cards.name: Brachiosaur
variable_cards.description: The discovery of this colossal creature on the isolated isles of the Diadem has perplexed naturalists, who had thought the ancient species long extinct. Possessed of an innate arcane might proportionate to its size, the brachiosaur defends itself with a meteoric rain of conjured boulders.

rewards.name: Koja
rewards.description: A golem mainly constructed for the purpose of serving onmyoji and geomancers, the bulbous form of a koja is fashioned from sticky mud and imbued with the spirit of a shikigami. The features common to all koja are believed to be modeled after the original creator─a eunuch from ancient times─but no portrait has ever been found to substantiate this claim.

rewards.name: Lupin
rewards.description: This wolf-headed beast tribe has its origins on the continent of Othard. Known for their martial traditions, the Lupin became an integral part of Doman warfare after several of their clans pledged fealty to the region's warlords during their endless clash for supremacy. When the Empire seized control, however, many Lupin were conscripted into the imperial army and forced to fight abroad.

fixed_cards.name: Hisui & Kurenai
fixed_cards.description: “To prove my point, here is a quick test for you─look very closely and tell me: am I Kurenai...or am I Hisui?”

fixed_cards.name: Louisoix Leveilleur
fixed_cards.description: “Silence, chattering raven. Your wretched wings are broken, and you shall soar no more.”

fixed_cards.name: Hildibrand & Nashu Mhakaracca
fixed_cards.description: “I swear to you, here and now: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, shall scour all creation─from the deepest pit of the seven hells to the very pinnacle of the heavens─for your Pure Heart!”

variable_cards.name: Ango
variable_cards.description: This Far Eastern relative to the orobon owes its name to its slack-jawed and slow-witted appearance. Originally called “angu uo” in the local tongue, the word for this “imbecilic fish” was eventually shortened to the present “ango.”

variable_cards.name: Cloud of Darkness
variable_cards.description: One of the undisputed rulers of the void and an entity of immeasurable strength, the Cloud of Darkness occupies the highest rung of the hierarchy of twelve. This terrifying voidsent entered into a dark covenant with Emperor Xande of Allag in a bid to invade the physical realm.

variable_cards.name: Nael van Darnus
variable_cards.description: “The hour of cleansing is at hand—by my searing light shall the world be purged of its taint.”

variable_cards.name: Tiamat
variable_cards.description: One of the seven great wyrms sired by Midgardsormr, Father of Dragons. Following in the wake of her sibling Bahamut, Tiamat crossed to the southern continent of Meracydia where she became mother to her own expansive brood. Until this very day, she is tormented by the decision to resurrect her fallen brother as a primal in their failed resistance against the invading Allagan Empire.

variable_cards.name: Calofisteri
variable_cards.description: Head crowned with animate tresses and mind caressed by madness, Calofisteri haunts the Tomb of the Nullstone as the relic's self-appointed guardian. This mighty sorceress of Mhach achieved a twisted form of immortality by combining the power of aether-infused crystal with the ritual consumption of voidsent blood.

rewards.name: Ango
rewards.description: This Far Eastern relative to the orobon owes its name to its slack-jawed and slow-witted appearance. Originally called “angu uo” in the local tongue, the word for this “imbecilic fish” was eventually shortened to the present “ango.”

rewards.name: Hisui & Kurenai
rewards.description: “To prove my point, here is a quick test for you─look very closely and tell me: am I Kurenai...or am I Hisui?”

fixed_cards.name: Tansui
fixed_cards.description: “I realize you do not look kindly on the Confederacy and her ways. But if you refuse to pay the Ruby Tithe, your safety in these waters cannot be assured.”

fixed_cards.name: Rasho
fixed_cards.description: “Men who revere manners and tradition can be found the world over. But not here.”

fixed_cards.name: Vedrfolnir
fixed_cards.description: Sired by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr, Vedrfolnir's fiercely aggressive demeanor sets him apart from his tranquil broodmates. This mighty dragon revels in the glory of combat, and has fostered a deadly rivalry with Darkscale, a general in Nidhogg's Horde.

variable_cards.name: Memeroon
variable_cards.description: “Stop, stop, stop! Memeroon give you shinies! Many, many shinies to repay repayments!”

variable_cards.name: Rhitahtyn sas Arvina
variable_cards.description: “In the name of Lord van Baelsar, I, Rhitahtyn sas Arvina, do swear to strike you down!”

variable_cards.name: Hoary Boulder & Coultenet
variable_cards.description:
“On your feet, Hoary!”
“Can't...disappoint...the younglings... Raaargh!”

rewards.name: Tansui
rewards.description: “I realize you do not look kindly on the Confederacy and her ways. But if you refuse to pay the Ruby Tithe, your safety in these waters cannot be assured.”

quest.name: By the Grace of Lord Lolorito

fixed_cards.name: Hancock
fixed_cards.description: “Once again, I must apologize. Too much time in the Far East, you see. One is compelled to talk in circles around everything here, and one finds oneself longing for the invigoratingly candid speech of the Ul'dahn markets.”

fixed_cards.name: Vidofnir
fixed_cards.description: Vidofnir was sired by the great wyrm Hraesvelgr. A creature of great age, she has memories of the era when man and dragon lived together in peace, and is revered as an elder by others of her brood.

fixed_cards.name: Gaius van Baelsar
fixed_cards.description: “Unworthy is the ruler whose subjects seek the solace of false gods.”

variable_cards.name: Cid Garlond
variable_cards.description: “Just how long have I worn these damn goggles?”

variable_cards.name: Ferdiad
variable_cards.description: Summoned in ages past by the sorcerers of Mhach to join the assault on Amdapor, this scythe-wielding voidsent was defeated by the city's defenders and consigned to languish behind potent seals. As a lesser noble, Ferdiad occupies the third rung of the hierarchy of twelve.

variable_cards.name: Pipin Tarupin
variable_cards.description: “There will be ample time for soul-searching later. For now, we must put some malms between us and Ul'dah.”

variable_cards.name: Alexander Prime
variable_cards.description: Alexander Prime served as the last line of defense for the mechanical primal's innermost core. As an integral element of the core's central control system, Alexander Prime exhibited a limited ability to manipulate temporal reality, and sought to smite intruders with its divine judgment.

rewards.name: Hancock
rewards.description: “Once again, I must apologize. Too much time in the Far East, you see. One is compelled to talk in circles around everything here, and one finds oneself longing for the invigoratingly candid speech of the Ul'dahn markets.”

fixed_cards.name: Wanyudo & Katasharin
fixed_cards.description: A mammet-type construction prevalent in the Far East. The cartwheels, adorned with the unsettling faces of a man and woman, are said to resemble mythical apparitions known for stealing the souls of any who look upon them─a design deliberately intended to frighten away cowardly interlopers.

fixed_cards.name: Hatamoto
fixed_cards.description: The spirit of an armored warrior who died in battle. The hatamoto are a class of soldier in Hingashi who often fought as personal guards for the nobility during the Age of Blood. Great numbers of these loyal vassals perished on the battlefield, and their battered, armor-clad forms are sometimes still spotted wandering the land in search of elusive victory.

fixed_cards.name: Hiruko
fixed_cards.description: An adversary faced on the thirtieth floor of Heaven-on-High. Standing as a challenge for those heroes who would battle against threats of cataclysmic proportions, Hiruko was created through forbidden arts now lost to the world.

variable_cards.name: Ango
variable_cards.description: This Far Eastern relative to the orobon owes its name to its slack-jawed and slow-witted appearance. Originally called “angu uo” in the local tongue, the word for this “imbecilic fish” was eventually shortened to the present “ango.”

variable_cards.name: Kojin
variable_cards.description: This marine race of beastmen has lived in the Ruby Sea for generations. As at home underwater as they are on land, they have flourished on the bounty of the ocean. The Kojin revere the kami─a legion of gods found within the great and the small─and strive ceaselessly to collect those objects in which they believe their deities reside.

variable_cards.name: Tansui
variable_cards.description: “I realize you do not look kindly on the Confederacy and her ways. But if you refuse to pay the Ruby Tithe, your safety in these waters cannot be assured.”

variable_cards.name: Rasho
variable_cards.description: “Men who revere manners and tradition can be found the world over. But not here.”

rewards.name: Hiruko
rewards.description: An adversary faced on the thirtieth floor of Heaven-on-High. Standing as a challenge for those heroes who would battle against threats of cataclysmic proportions, Hiruko was created through forbidden arts now lost to the world.

rewards.name: Hatamoto
rewards.description: The spirit of an armored warrior who died in battle. The hatamoto are a class of soldier in Hingashi who often fought as personal guards for the nobility during the Age of Blood. Great numbers of these loyal vassals perished on the battlefield, and their battered, armor-clad forms are sometimes still spotted wandering the land in search of elusive victory.

rewards.name: Wanyudo & Katasharin
rewards.description: A mammet-type construction prevalent in the Far East. The cartwheels, adorned with the unsettling faces of a man and woman, are said to resemble mythical apparitions known for stealing the souls of any who look upon them─a design deliberately intended to frighten away cowardly interlopers.

quest.name: And We Shall Call It Pyros

fixed_cards.name: Louhi
fixed_cards.description: Encountered in the frozen wasteland of Pagos, this formidable voidsent employs its immense arcane strength to condense blades of ice from the surrounding aether. Scholars have yet to perform a comprehensive study, but the presence of numerous underlings suggest that in the voidsent hierarchy, Louhi holds at the very least the rank of lesser noble.

fixed_cards.name: Pazuzu
fixed_cards.description: Explorers of Eureka Anemos claim that when the wind howls across that forbidden land, it is the sound of the dead heralding the advent of high voidsent and lord of the gales, Pazuzu. Considering what little is known of the Isle of Val and its logic-defying laws of nature, those claims could bear more truth than fiction.

fixed_cards.name: Krile
fixed_cards.description: “Would you care to attempt a more dextrous deflection?”

variable_cards.name: Happy Bunny
variable_cards.description: As the name implies, this small, curious creature is rumored to bring fortune wherever it goes. Upon taking a liking to someone─the requisite for which is not understood─the bunny will lead this favored individual to the location of hidden treasures. Participants in the Eureka field investigations have reported several sightings of the beasts, but little else is known about their habits or life cycle.

variable_cards.name: Yukinko
variable_cards.description: A close relative of the korpokkur, the yukinko cover themselves with a pointed hat of grass stalks to protect themselves from the cold and the falling snow. Known as “wintering,” this behavior has been mimicked by Far Eastern gardeners as a means of sheltering their own vulnerable trees and shrubs from the elements.

variable_cards.name: Gerolt
variable_cards.description: “Jus' let me make one thing clear: it might be as I'm repairin' kettles to pay for yesterday's mead, but I still got me pride as a master weaponsmith. Ye'll get no less than the finest out of me forge.”

rewards.name: Louhi
rewards.description: Encountered in the frozen wasteland of Pagos, this formidable voidsent employs its immense arcane strength to condense blades of ice from the surrounding aether. Scholars have yet to perform a comprehensive study, but the presence of numerous underlings suggest that in the voidsent hierarchy, Louhi holds at the very least the rank of lesser noble.

Considering what little is known of the Isle of Val and its logic-defying laws of nature, those claims could bear more truth than fiction.

Upon taking a liking to someone─the requisite for which is not understood─the bunny will lead this favored individual to the location of hidden treasures. Participants in the Eureka field investigations have reported several sightings of the beasts, but little else is known about their habits or life cycle.

fixed_cards.name: Karakuri Hanya
fixed_cards.description: Fitted with a mask of the hanya─a symbol of extreme envy and malice─this automaton is a marriage of Doman ingenuity and Hingan design. Its creators, somehow uncertain that a high-powered crossbow welded to one arm and a ludicrously large mace to the other would provide the golem with sufficient means of punishing its victims, also installed variations with a self-destruct mechanism capable of laying waste to nearby attackers.

fixed_cards.name: Yojimbo & Daigoro
fixed_cards.description:
“Your coffers appear empty, Kageyama.
If you cannot pay my price, then I am finished here.”

fixed_cards.name: Koja
fixed_cards.description: A golem mainly constructed for the purpose of serving onmyoji and geomancers, the bulbous form of a koja is fashioned from sticky mud and imbued with the spirit of a shikigami. The features common to all koja are believed to be modeled after the original creator─a eunuch from ancient times─but no portrait has ever been found to substantiate this claim.

variable_cards.name: Namazu
variable_cards.description: A beast tribe native to the Far East. Short and squat, the Namazu are nevertheless excellent swimmers, and subsist mainly on a diet of harpooned fish. Though proximity to the settlements of other races has done much to civilize these sociable creatures, a significant number of their clans yet remain wild and savage.

variable_cards.name: Kotokaze
variable_cards.description: “We would welcome your custom, miss.”

variable_cards.name: Hildibrand & Nashu Mhakaracca
variable_cards.description: “I swear to you, here and now: I, Hildibrand, agent of enquiry, inspector extraordinaire, shall scour all creation─from the deepest pit of the seven hells to the very pinnacle of the heavens─for your Pure Heart!”

variable_cards.name: Kojin
variable_cards.description: This marine race of beastmen has lived in the Ruby Sea for generations. As at home underwater as they are on land, they have flourished on the bounty of the ocean. The Kojin revere the kami─a legion of gods found within the great and the small─and strive ceaselessly to collect those objects in which they believe their deities reside.

rewards.name: Karakuri Hanya
rewards.description: Fitted with a mask of the hanya─a symbol of extreme envy and malice─this automaton is a marriage of Doman ingenuity and Hingan design. Its creators, somehow uncertain that a high-powered crossbow welded to one arm and a ludicrously large mace to the other would provide the golem with sufficient means of punishing its victims, also installed variations with a self-destruct mechanism capable of laying waste to nearby attackers.

rewards.name: Yojimbo & Daigoro
rewards.description:
“Your coffers appear empty, Kageyama.
If you cannot pay my price, then I am finished here.”

quest.name: And We Shall Call It Hydatos

fixed_cards.name: Ejika Tsunjika
fixed_cards.description: “Does your Eorzean stubbornness know no end!? I have urgent business on that island, and I demand you take me there at once!”

fixed_cards.name: Penthesilea
fixed_cards.description: Crowned the “Queen of Flame” by some, this majestic voidsent dwells in the searing lands of Pyros. Penthesilea has gorged herself on the region's fiery aether, the unbalanced energies augmenting her already formidable magicks of fire and destruction.

fixed_cards.name: Dvergr
fixed_cards.description: Occupying the fourth rung of the hierarchy of twelve, this voidsent serves as an artisan for its fiendish kin. Dvergr has a profound understanding of metalwork and goldsmithing, and no few of the armaments wielded by the void's denizens were created in its hellish forge.

fixed_cards.name: Provenance Watcher
fixed_cards.description: This crystalline monstrosity is known to dwell in the watery reaches of Eureka Hydatos. Although it takes the shape of a greater dragon, the creature is believed to have simply mimicked a wyrm-like form, and is, in fact, closer in nature to the luminare─an arcane entity spawned by a concentration of ambient aether.

variable_cards.name: Happy Bunny
variable_cards.description: As the name implies, this small, curious creature is rumored to bring fortune wherever it goes. Upon taking a liking to someone─the requisite for which is not understood─the bunny will lead this favored individual to the location of hidden treasures. Participants in the Eureka field investigations have reported several sightings of the beasts, but little else is known about their habits or life cycle.
